intro: Crusea guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan crusea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
